boardgame.name: Anvilgard City Guide
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Through the mist lies a city unlike any other in the Mortal Realms, where even the shadows have claws. The God-King himself cannot see the darkness that lies there.

At the northernmost end of the Flamescar Plateau rise the Brutos Hills, a dense jungle-covered series of volcanic peaks that borders part of the infamous Charrwind Coast. Called the Crucible of Life, the area is filled with unruly plant life, dangerous beasts, hideous monsters, and huge lizards, along with the remains of kingdoms toppled by the same. Here lies Anvilgard, the City of Scales, a gloomy frontier port city on the edge of the Searing Sea. The streets of Anvilgard are forever wreathed in shadows, filled with a defoliant mist created by Ironweld alchemists to hold the rampant plant growth, which would otherwise overwhelm the city within days, in check.

The Anvilgard City Guide gives players and Gamemasters everything they need to adventure in the mist-shrouded streets of Anvilgard. Wander the city’s infamous black markets, visit the cacophonous Hammercroft smithing district, or test your skills in the deadly fighting pits.

The Anvilgard City Guide contains:

The history of Anvilgard and how it came to be.
Information on the major players in the city — and what to do to stay out of their way.
Over 70 locations in Anvilgard and beyond the walls.
New items to purchase in the city’s black markets.
New Endeavours unique to the city of Anvilgard — join in blood sports or train a new Loyal Companion!
Two new creatures — the fire-breathing Salamander and the foul-tempered Drakespawn

boardgame.name: Basilica of the Dune-Cursed Messiah
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

We thought we would die out here, to be lost beneath the shifting sands of this desert, when the ranger spotted a well. Of course, there was no water in it, but our voices echoes oddly. When we took a risk and climbed down the shaft, we discovered an enormous temple full of books and scrolls! Millennia of forgotten knowledge. Of course, no great wealth goes unguarded...

This is a system-agnostic dungeon designed to slot easily into whatever kind of campaign you might be running. Use it as a random wilderness encounter, a challenge between your party and that healing break they're so eager for, or the start to a dragon nemesis campaign.

boardgame.name: The Observatories of Nerak
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The wizard pinpointed the origin of all the odd magical surges disturbing her experiments - they seem to be coming from a trio of ancient observatories. We thought they'd be abandoned but - to the contrary! The elves here seem quite eager for our help, though it's impossible to tell if they're more scared of the dragon plaguing the region... or the astronomers who inhabit the towers.

This is a system-agnostic dungeon designed to slot easily into whatever kind of campaign you might be running. Use it as an elven settlement, a random wilderness encounter, or the location of important information/items the party needs.

boardgame.name: Quetz Waterfall
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The artificer insisted we visit a specific point along the Quetz River - a waterfall rumoured to have once hosted the richest port on this side of the continent. The stone carving was interesting, but not very promising. Then we found the cave entrance, and everything changed. The remains of an entire civilisation, hidden for thousands of years! The only thing is, we keep seeing movement in the shadows and the fish are acting very strangely...

This is a system-agnostic dungeon designed to slot easily into whatever kind of campaign you might be running. Use it as a random settlement encounter, a local place of worship, or the location of knowledge your party seeks.

boardgame.name: Night at the Mausoleum
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Farmers in the middle realm have seen a lot of strange, and yes, gross stuff. But this time it might be too much. Find out what's grosser than gross in the small town of Barot, climb the perilous peaks of the Thirsty Maw, and spend a night in the Mausoleum - if you're not afraid. And if you are, bring a friend.

Night At the Mausoleum was originally my first full length meal when I launched BattleSauce in October of 2019. As a one year celebration, I updated the layout, refreshed the writing, added new art, and revised all the maps and present it here for free! Share with your friends, battle your enemies, or play it with the family. Lots of options there.

Not ready for a meal? Try a Snack and chow down on some BattleSauce bite-sized adventures - perfect for learning the not-too-many rules - and available wherever BattleSauce battles are sold. HINT: DriveThru and my website have a bunch of free ones too.

Some say nothing in life is free, well this is and it's just for y'all!

34 Pages of new stories and art along with a little game mechanic spice sprinkled on top!
4 Shiny, new, and spooky full color maps of terror!
4 New characters - with one or two ready to be brought back from the dead.
A vine covered monster who's none too happy to have you in his place of residence.
A hammer that only the worthy...dang it, did it again. An awesome hammer that's yours for the taking...if you can find it.
Uncharted maps to add as much terror as you wish to your players!

boardgame.name: Blackleg Chronicles: Rise of the Chieftain
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Blackleg Chronicles - Rise of the Chieftain - the third installment of an Adventure Module for the Realm of Onasti This retro style publication provides the new Dungeon Master all the details required for a fun role playing experience.

Learn the secrets of the Black Dragon Clan, discover the Blackleg Clan's secret plot and encounter a fearsome Black Dragon. This adventure is the third installment of the Blackleg Chronicles Series.

boardgame.name: The Beastspeaker
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:



Keep it Simple: Beastspeaker

Simple classes are trimmed-down, streamlined classes designed to be easy to pick up and play for both new players and system veterans! Each has a sleek core set of abilities that isn’t bogged down with options backed up with a strong but balanced chassis (HD, saves, BAB, etc).


Beastspeaker Base Class (Pathfinder 1st Editon)

As lord of beasts a beastspeaker is both at home among the wilds and able to command with animals.

boardgame.name: The Crypt of Anghavik
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Anghavik is remembered as a hero from a past age among Castiel’s northeastern towns. Unlike the many forgotten warriors who died protecting this coveted stretch of coastline, his name endures in part to his burial crypt that salutes his defense against the great Dracian raiding chief, Gedrun the Bold. It was Anghavik who struck down Gedrun’s son and cleaved Gedrun’s right arm clean off in the Battle of the Bleak Shallows, defeating a bloodthirsty scourge. A century later, the crypt has sat unattended after recent changes by the town of Bumaegra’s elder council, and now a hungering evil walks its corridors.

The Crypt of Anghavik is a Q-Crawl, or Quick-Crawl, that can be run for a group of four to six players with 4th-level characters. This crawl would be considered a ‘medium’ to ‘hard’ encounter.

boardgame.name: Catrina
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The catrina creature feature is a holiday special module for the Legends System™ tabletop roleplaying game ruleset that can be effortlessly inserted into any of its worlds of legend™. Of course, you can also choose to adapt the creature stats for its use with any other existing campaign setting or game system you already play with.

boardgame.name: TinyZine (Issue 27)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The twenty-seventh issue of TinyZine, the Gallant Knight Games e-zine is here! This is an adventure-packed issue!

Letter from the Editor: Alan Bahr
Four new heritages from Steffie de Vaan: Animal Kin
New locations and heritages for Tiny Frontiers: Revised from Jonathan Hicks
Colin Chapman finishes his Tiny Trinkets column!

boardgame.name: TinyZine (Issue 28)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The twenth-eighth issue of TinyZine, the Gallant Knight Games e-zine is here! We have a slew of great content from our regular contributors!

Exalted Performers from Steffie de Vaan
The Dog Moon by Jonathan Hicks
Lake Taaris, Episode 3 by Will Munn
TSignature Sorceries by Colin Chapman!

boardgame.name: Passenger's Ulterior Motives
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Why have a passenger that is there only to make the player's some money when you can screw with them at the same time? d66 Passenger's Ulterior Motives gives you the ideas you need to make every single passenger memorable and a jumping-off point for adventure.
22 Falsely accused of a crime, doesn't believe they will get a fair trial
35 Mentally unstable conspiracy theorist wants to prove slave ring on ship
62 Smuggler, wearing stolen goods on their body for the whole trip

boardgame.name: Philosophy Book Titles
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Every play a well-red character or have an NPC that wants to show off how much they know? They should casually mention a book title from the future. But how can you name a book that does not exist yet? d66 Philosophy Book Titles gives you a brand new collection of books that your character can work into the conversation. Add depth to your character today.
14 Achieving Happiness And Other Impossible Acts
34 Meditating Upon the Stars
63 The Technocracy by Dunowan

boardgame.name: vs. ASSASSINS
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Whoever comes, whoever it is... I'll kill them. I'll kill them all.”
-John Wick

vs. ASSASSINS is a small roleplaying game about undertaking a perilous journey of bloody revenge through a world of assassins, heavily inspired by the John Wick movie franchIse. You'll need one other player, a deck of playing cards for each of you, some pencils (to write with), paper, and about three hours.

You are a Killer. Someone did you wrong. You won't stop.
You can't stop.

vs. ASSASSINS is a complete game, suitable for a single game session or for an extended campaign. Inside, you’ll find:

Rules for creating a Killer.
A fast-playing game system based on Philip J. Reed’s vs. Monsters.
Many people who will die, trying to stop you.


Also in this package: vs. SPY, a gameplay modification about espionage and betrayal. This mode is good for 3-4 other players, each with identical standard decks of playing cards. You are an agent of a secretive intelligence agency. You are told your fellow agents can be trusted; you can trust Control. You are smarter than that..

boardgame.name: Wriggle-Hack
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Beware the Wriggle-Hack!

This is our 11th Monday Mutant of an initial 12 freaks in this series. These horrific, bear sized ambush hunters use multiple electric shock tentacles to subdue their prey before they drag them off to deposit in a crevice, backroom, or pit for later consumption. This 7 page PDF includes a random table for other unfortunate beings who also find themselves in a larder pit … with some of the fellow creatures on the menu being potential allies in any escape plan, while others who might well harm the character.

Also included with this all-new mutie is a selection of 5 Adventure hooks to jump-start a heroic quest that involves these cruel, ravenous harvesters of the mutated new era.

boardgame.name: The Pillar Tomb of Dumuzi
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:



Mysterious Tombs, Treasure & Adventure!

The Pillar Tomb of Dumuzi is a strange, above-ground tomb. That is difficult to find and well-guarded. But once inside, it contains great treasure beyond the greed of any adventurer. This adventure is not written in the typical format. There is a before/after presentation of the information, as in before the PCs pillage the tomb and after they pillage the tomb.

And of course, if they never steal anything, nothing will happen.

boardgame.name: Started from the Bottom
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurp:

Lighting the Electric Town

Neo-Tokyo, where the bright neon makes for some deep shadows. It’s not the easiest place to navigate, but the rewards for learning how it works are high. Want a shot at the big time? Then you have to start somewhere. And there are always openings at the bottom.

That doesn’t mean life will be either safe or boring. Dedicated runners can be caught in the mayhem of a troll metal concert, look for the right way to shake down a business, show some punks who’s the boss, and give a corp drone what’s coming to him. There may be bigger-paying jobs out there, but getting these jobs right is the first step to getting them.

SRM 09-01: Started from the Bottom is the first Mission in the Neo-Tokyo series of Shadowrun: Missions and a great way to launch into the evolving storyline! Even better, it’s dual-statted, so it can be used with both Shadowrun, Sixth World and Shadowrun, Fifth Edition. This is the time to jump into one of the Sixth World’s most dynamic settings!

boardgame.name: Marshals
boardgame.description:
Players turned into brave Marshals will have to capture a gang of 4 dangerous outlaws in a manhunt set in the Wild West.

They will travel across mountains, forests, plains, and deserts.

The Marshals will have to survive ambushes, find clues that will lead them to the fugitives, arrest them, and enforce the law while taking the occasional break.

Whoever captures them first will receive a generous bounty and the honor of becoming the Marshal who put an end to their mischief.

You choose how to go down in history: as the best Marshal ever, or maybe as the richest...

OBJECTIVE:

The goal of the game is to capture the 4 Outlaws, members of a dangerous gang of criminals, who are hidden among the cards of the Far West deck.
At the end of the game, the winner will be the Marshal who meets one of the following victory conditions, in this order:

If you are the only player left in the game after eliminating the other Marshals.
If you are the Corrupt Marshal and 1 Outlaw manages to get away indefinitely.
If you are the Marshal (corrupt or not) with the most money


earned, unless another player has captured 3 or more Outlaws.

END OF THE GAME:

The end of the game is triggered when one of the following
conditions is met:

When all the Outlaws have been captured.
If the last Outlaw has managed to get away indefinitely. In this case, the winner is the Corrupt Marshal
When there is only 1 Marshal left in the game.


—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Sega Game Pack 4 in 1
boardgame.description:
Sega Game Pack 4 in 1 is a compilation for the Sega Game Gear. It was only released in Europe.

Included are four untitled games - a Columns clone, in which the player aims for groups of four pieces rather than lines of three, a simple penalty shoot-out game, a basic rally game and a simple tennis game (where the umpire is Sonic the Hedgehog). The tennis and puzzle games were recycled from Kuni Chan no Game Tengoku.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Eos
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

First contact was only the beginning.

We couldn’t agree whether to send soldiers, explorers, or diplomats, so the crew of the Eos is expected to be all three. You go wherever Sol Command sends you, but your priorities are clear: Protect humanity unto the ends of the galaxy, make nice with the Council of Worlds, and prove our worth to the interstellar community.

boardgame.name: Orbital Decay
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Something brought you here.

Just a busted jump drive, you hoped. You can salvage parts from the derelict orbiting nearby, if you can finish before it crashes into the planet in a few hours. But it’s not that easy. Where’s the derelict’s crew? Why were gravity and life support disabled? Something brought you here. It wasn’t just bad luck. And it won’t let you leave.

boardgame.name: Project Ikaros
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Psychic powers are real - that’s common knowledge now. If you hear someone in your head, or see someone setting fires with a glance, you report it. Someone will take care of it. That someone is sent by Project Ikaros. And if you have psychic powers, or care about anyone who does, you’re either working for Ikaros, working against them, or trying to get away from them.

boardgame.name: Last Stand at Copper Canyon
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Your base is under attack!

Sinister forces stalk the Mournland for salvagers, dragging captives to their scrapyard lair which courses with creation magic.

Take control of arcane wrecking balls, giant magnets, and more as you crush, grab, and smash your way through Copper Canyon Scrapyard!

Last Stand at Copper Canyon is a DDAL - Oracle of War salvage mission for Tier 2 (levels 5 - 10) characters that can be completed in 3-4 hours. It's DDAL - D&D Adventurers League legal if used in conjunction with Oracle of War: Salvage Bases and Missions.

boardgame.name: Hints at Imbalance: Rumors of Moloch
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Not to be outdone by Zariel and Avernus, the scheming cultists of Moloch have worked to summon him to the Prime Material and help his schemes to ascend to power once in again in the Nine Hells.

This adventure takes the adventurers into a forgotten crypt to investigate the rumors of a fiendish cult seeking the souls of unknown passersby to sell their souls for their lives

A Four- to Six-Hour Adventure for tier 3 Characters.

Optimized for APL 13.

boardgame.name: Lost Holy Man: Portal Chase Through Maladomini
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The devils of the Maladomini have extended their reach into the conflict on Avernus. Baalzebul is scheming to steal the souls of Elturel for himself. If the characters have already finished Avernus, then Baalzebul wants to take the souls that Zariel failed to bring into the hells. If not, he wants to steal the souls promised to Zariel in some way but needs to better understand the contract that binds their souls to her service.

Four Adventure for Tier 3 Characters. Optimized for APL 13.

boardgame.name: The Headless Haunting of Berengar Manor
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

Dark rumors have been whispered in the village for years of the vile deeds of Berengar the Brutal and his wife Ra'za'zsu the Cruel. Their manor, now long abandoned, still haunts the nightmares of those who worked there in their youth. When two of Berengar's fromer servants go missing and their grandson seeks help in finding them, will your adventurers be ready?

A adventure suitable for level 1 or 2 characters that can be played in a 3-4 hour session.

Now includes full color maps in 150 dpi, 70 dpi and 50 dpi for printing and Virtual Tabletops (VTT)!
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: 2 WORM 2 FURIOUS
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A deadly funnel (Level 0+) adventure and mini-setting, for 4-6 players, revolving around an ever mutating and evolving moth grub. THE grub has escaped and you have been charged by the God-Queen to bring it back to the hatchery, but this is a funnel after all… so stuff will inevitably go wrong and will likely be fatal.

It’s a tiny worm, that grows and grows and grows, and rampages, and bursts into a colossal Doombringer Moth that’s a Patron, a Deity, and a raging behemoth. It grows and grows, its growth unlocks new abilities and reactions. It rarely acts the same way, and eventually it will rule. WORSHIP IT OR RUN FROM IT, IT DOESN’T MATTER!

A God-Queen, her throne-maidens, the legions of Sky-Knights (on their Worm-Hawks), Stilt-Walkers, and Knights that strike with the fury of a thousand hammers. In addition there’s a couple important NPCs stirring things up and causing problems. Ranging from a veteran sky-knight to turned bartender, to a Jester that loiters in the streets spreading whispers to those that live below.
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: City of Thralls
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a one-shot adventure for 5th edition. Recommended party level of 3.
...
A city falls into chaos as a mysterious force enthralls many citizens, turning them into mindless drones that wander the streets. People dissappear in the night and the enthralled citizens become increasingly violent as time goes on. The party must get to the bottom of what is causing this before it is too late.

boardgame.name: The Starlit Tomb
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a one-shot adventure for 5th edition. Recommended party level of at least 5.
...
This campaign starts as an investigation in a town that is haunted by evil spirits at night, and quickly turns into a dungeon-crawler in an underground tomb. The dungeon is designed to be playable in one or two sessions, but still contains dynamic elements that can make subsequent playthroughs unique. Most enemies encountered are undead.

boardgame.name: The Duke of Oorn
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a backstory, stat block, and map token for a low-level villain in a fantasy setting. Designed with 5th edition in mind, but can be modified to fit other systems.

boardgame.name: Lurker's Prey
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a one-shot adventure for 5th edition. Recommended party level of 3rd-4th.
...
This is a survival-type adventure that starts with the party getting shipwrecked on an unknown island. There are a couple factions on the island, providing several options for the party to find their way off the island safely.

boardgame.name: Idol Hunting
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a one-shot adventure for 5th edition. Recommended party level of 2.
...
This campaign kicks off with a reward for retrieving an ancient idol from deep in the jungle. There are several paths through the jungle outlined in the module, with several accompanying battle maps for different settings. Can your party find the idol, and possibly discover the motive behind the person who wants it?

boardgame.name: Fruit of Palume
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a one-shot adventure for 5th edition. Recommended party level of 1.
...
This campaign involves a light-hearted mystery involving a sommelier, several competing wineries, and getting brainwashed and left outside in the middle of the night in your underwear. Not a lot of combat opportunities in this one (unless your party is feeling particularly violent today), but plenty of unique characters and role-playing opportunities.

boardgame.name: Belinda and the Birds
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a one-shot adventure for 5th edition. Recommended party level of 3.
...
A rumor has been spreading among every small town and farm in the region: bringing an offering to the summit of Goldenhoof Mountain will yeild a blessing of the traveler's choosing! When crop harvests are low and the people wonder if they will live through the winter, they chose a party of adventurers to travel to the top of the mountain for a blessing of good harvest. What sort of challenges do they face on this journey?

boardgame.name: Dregan's Delve
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Can the adventurers save a gang of salt miners from the strange creatures that plague their pit?

Dregan's Delve is a short adventure set in a generic pseudo-medieval fantasy setting, easily transported into your own campaign for an evening's entertainment.

boardgame.name: MacGowan & Lombardy's The Great War
boardgame.description:
MacGowan & Lombardy's The Great War by award-winning game designer Dana Lombardy is a simple, fast-playing stand-alone (non-collectible) 2-player card game built around important weapon systems, commanders, and other historical aspects of this unprecedented industrial-scale war. Two 54-card decks feature colorized historical images and illustrations by game industry Hall of Fame graphic artist Rodger B. MacGowan. Icons, insignias, and game text on each card eliminate the need for complex rules. (Note to collectors: Nearly all of Rodger's exceptional WW1 illustrations appear on the cards.)

—description from the publisher

listing.notes:
This is a brandnew, sealed copy. Latest edition. Fresh from Kickstarter. USA shipping $13.75 (Medium Flat Rate Box). Can combine shipping for multiple games.
2 lbs 13x10x4 inch
with battle mat
very nice art on the cards…

boardgame.name: ACIS: Adventurer Caregivers In Support (of Adventurer Caregivers)
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

Styles of Play: Freeform larp, Larp, Letter Writing, Streaming/Online Face to Face

Intro: Being the parent or caregiver of an adventurer is stressful. Be they prophesied for greatness, runaway royals, or even following in the family’s footsteps, you never know when they will get injured, cursed, or resurrected as a dire boar. In this game, each player will both play a former character of theirs from a tabletop game and the caregiver of another adventurer. Scenes take place during an support group that is happening via magical viewing devices and are interspersed with letter writing about your former character’s adventures to their caregiver. Will you be able to learn to cope with your fears? Will you find the support you need? And how will your relationship with your ward change?

Tags: fantasy, family dynamics, support groups
boardgame.rpg: ACIS: Adventurer Caregivers In Support (of Adventurer Caregivers)

boardgame.name: All We Have Is Us
boardgame.description:
Styles of Play: Freeform larp, Letter Writing, Streaming/Online Face to Face

All We Have Is Us is a game for 3-6 players and one facilitator inspired by classic heist and jailbreak stories. But rather than replaying the job itself, this experience is designed to inspire reflection on a simple question that doesn’t have a simple answer: if you knew the end was coming and you’d never see your friends again, what would you share? What would you confess?

Tags: Emotional, Streaming, Online, Secrets

boardgame.name: Arbor Day
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

Styles of Play: Freeform larp, Larp, Pervasive Game/Public Play, Journaling

You have angered the trees by disrespecting Arbor Day. As punishment, they have trapped you in a time loop. Now, Arbor Day is forever.

Tags: Freeform, journaling, self-reflection, timeloop

boardgame.name: Awake at the Witching Hour
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

Styles of Play: Freeform larp, Larp

A haunted LARP experience for one player. The game takes place over several nights as you play a character experiencing a haunting.

Tags: Horror, Ghosts, Solo LARP

boardgame.name: The Batcave
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

Styles of Play: Freeform larp, Streaming/Online Face to Face, Performance (ie song, lipsynch, dance etc.)

A 1.5h long lighthearted game for 2 to 5 players where you play a family of bats finding a new home. The game uses a Zoom feature that makes it super easy to turn your video upside-down - so you appear like hanging from the ceiling.

Tags: LAOG, bats, family, fun

boardgame.name: The Bathhouse
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

Styles of Play: Freeform larp, Larp, Streaming/Online Face to Face, Video/Transmedia, Bathing; Audio chat

This is a game about gods, queerness, the power of shared myths, and the intimacy of bathing together. A group of old friends take a trip to a bathhouse together, to reminisce and share stories. In the intimate sanctuary of the bathhouse, as protective layers and long held feelings are stripped and encrusted dirt is washed away, who will they become? Will the gods awaken? This is a 3 hr LARP for 4 or 6 players designed to be played online in the comfort and safety of your own home. Players take a bath together in the middle; this section is played as an audio only experience, allowing you to lean back and relax in your bath.

Tags: Bathing, Myths, Friendships

boardgame.name: Pretense: Blanks
boardgame.description: A pack of 3 additional blank role cards and 1 blank reference card, so you can modify the game to meet the immediate needs of your game group.

boardgame.name: Call Your Mother
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

Styles of Play: Freeform larp, Larp, Chat/Message

This is a game about calling your mother... or more accurately trying not to call them. One person plays the adult survivor of child abuse, the other plays the parent (and partner of the abuse, not the abuser themself). The two go back and forth, perhaps towards confrontation, but likely not resolution.

Tags: phone, abuse, parent

boardgame.name: The Confluence
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

Styles of Play: Freeform larp, Larp, Streaming/Online Face to Face

Lonely gods that have recently regained their memories of what they are meet at a confluence of worlds once every 100 years.

Tags: gods loneliness memory choices

boardgame.name: Veil of Truth: Fallen Empires
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Explore the Forbidden Sector with a crew of dysfunctional outcasts and come across unique worlds, artifacts and aliens created on the fly!

Fallen Empires is part campaign setting, part toolkit for Game Masters to create adventures focused on exploring uncharted regions once ruled by long-dead empires.

Inside you will find:

Rules and tables to flesh out your exploration crew with Motivations and Flaws;
3 new alien races: the mysterious Celonians, the agressive Jakt and the multilimbed Thoy'ykoth;
Rules and tables on how to make the party's ship a character that impacts in plot and challenges;
The story of two Fallen Empires, the infamous Grey of the Coregency of Celon and the living machines of the Meridath Empire;
Details about Vega Ringstation and the Exploratory Corps;
Dozens of tables to help you create an exploration adventure, including how to create new locations, new artifacts and new creatures on the fly;
6 new alien enemies to throw against your players!

boardgame.name: Catrina's Catalogue of Underwarren Wares
boardgame.description:
"Venturing through the mysterious depths of the Underdark? Do not fear! This catalogue contains a myriad of useful items to aid your underground travels!

There are 21 unique magical and nonmagical items, each one accompanied by an illustration, rarity and suggested price in gold. The document is heavily themed to a vintage mail-order catalogue, so players can feel like they are browsing for items in-character."

(Author Summary)

boardgame.name: The Coeuriers
The Cœuriers
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

Styles of Play: Letter Writing, Arts & Crafts

The Cœuriers is a postal game where the envelopes, letters, and packages become the characters with which the players interact. Participants give birth to The Cœuriers by imagining backstory characters who provide the inspirational seeds for missives and parcels. As the game proceeds, The Cœuriers both transform and are transformed by the messages sent by the players to each other.

Tags: letters, packages, empathy

boardgame.name: Date Dreams
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

Styles of Play: Freeform larp, Pervasive Game/Public Play, Zero-Player Games, Non-Interactive App Interpretation

Players use their regular gay dating app to imagine abstract, dreamlike characters based on the incomplete, anonymized and exaggerated user profiles on the platform, and then play with these characters in different scenarios by asking and answering questions about them, all without interacting in any way with the people behind the profiles.

Tags: Gay, single-player, zero-player, online, erotic

boardgame.name: Dawn of the Monster Invasion
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

Styles of Play: Freeform larp, Larp, Streaming/Online Face to Face

A monster movie spoof told in 6 speeches

Tags: monster, comedy, horror, speeches

boardgame.name: Skeletons of the Past
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

5th Edition Mini-Dungeon for four characters of levels 9-10

For many generations Raskoron was a prominent dwarven city. Its ruin came when a group of dwarves snuck into the lair of the red dragon Chareshnavoch seeking treasure and instead stole her clutch of eggs.

The dragon’s response was swift and brutal, as fire engulfed Raskoron and Chareshnavoch razed the city, building by building, to the ground, with the survivors making their last stand in the forge-temple, which was also where the eggs were hidden.

Unable to breach the underground building, Chareshnavoch collapsed the entrances and trapped the defenders inside, unaware that she had also doomed her own offspring. Though all in the forge-temple eventually perished, the traumatic circumstances and anguish experienced made many rise as undead.

boardgame.name: Das große Bundesliga-Quiz
boardgame.description:
Das große Bundesliga-Quiz, The big Bundesliga quiz contains 900 questions on current and historical events in the 50-year Bundesliga history.
It is a knowledge quiz for young and old.
With different levels of difficulty, children can play against adults or against each other.
Four different game variants from training to tournaments, test your knowledge of the Bundesliga and stay exciting until the end.
The talking pen holds the points and cheers the players on.
Questions about the ewigen Tabelle, about current events (2013), club colors, club anthems, players etc...

boardgame.name: Ghost Letters
boardgame.description:
You are Detectives trying to solve a crime. You found 12 clues on the crime scene, but only 3 of these are True Clues.

One of you is the Ghost of the victim, who helps to solve the crime. Detectives choose and send Clues to the Ghost. The Ghost chooses and opens the best as the Hints.

One of you is the Murderer, who misleads investigation – in discussion and also bluffing about cards, that were sent to the Ghost and were not opened.

In 3 rounds the Detectives need to guess all the 3 True Clues OR any 2 True Clues + the Murderer.

More players – more different Roles: Accomplices, Witness, Expert, Blackmailer. In extended mode – players get characters with special abilities.

Selling Points:

a lot of common discussion
minimum of components and vivid Clues-pictures as the main part of the game
all players actively play: choose and send the Clues to the Ghost, discuss the open Hints and who they can trust
active bluffing of Murderer and Accomplices
mix of deduction and social game
works also for 2-3 players (full coop mode) and up to 12 players


—description from the designer

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: NAT 1
boardgame.description:
NAT 1 is RPG themed party game. Players react to wacky and unique situations of RPG's with their equally wacky and unique response. A judge plays a situation cards and the players submit their best response. The judge then chooses a winner of the round based on the accuracy or hilarity of the card. The judge then changes to the person on your left, and so on until one player wins five situations and is deemed the winner of the game. Enjoy this hysterical game that gives people an insight into the wonderful world of roleplaying and its endless possibilities.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Five Klicks Upgrade Pack
boardgame.description:
Time to power up your game. The Upgrade Pack adds the following content to Five Klicks

Talents - 20 special skills for the battle field and off of it, to help make your characters cooler and more distinctive.
Enhanced encounter table, updating the rulebook table to be tougher, more challenging and more interesting.
Story Points to tweak the outcomes of your games.
Gun upgrades. Tweak your firearms to create the perfect gun for your hero.
Chapter 1.1. Continue playing after you win, with increased difficulty.


—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Five Klicks From the Zone: Chapter 1 – Post collapse skirmish campaigns

boardgame.name: Oxi Day
boardgame.description:
In the wee hours of the morning of October 28th, 1940 Benito Mussolini, representing the Fascist party that had overthrown the Italian government, offered an ultimatum to Greece to submit to their authority. This demand contained a long list of capitulations including allowing Axis forces to enter and occupy fundamentally any "strategic location" they felt was appropriate.
Summoning his inner Leonidas, Prime Minister Ioannis Metaxas' apocryphal response to the litany of demands was simply "Οχι" ... No.

The scenario is designed to represent the battle as a skirmish at 1 figure:1,000 men, for QILS rules using 25mm or 28mm figures on 1” bases. Fifteen millimeter figures on 3/4” bases can be used by using centimeters instead of inches.
And of course, instead of skirmish figures you could use 6mm or 3mm figures on 1" bases.
The scenario makes a small board that is nice for games in more restricted environs, while still capturing the top level command challenge.
The troops are specified for our free QILS skirmish rules. Guidelines are provided to convert to other systems.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Signal: Unplugged
시그널
boardgame.description:
'Rinko', the best engineer in Folder Building.

'Rinko' assembles puzzle parts to create the ultimate robot.

To complete the robot, you need to find the parts in the folder room.

Let's take part in the algorithmic parade of the computer city.


How do computers work? 'Signal'


means conveying or commanding information about specific content through signs, symbols, sounds, gestures, etc.

Collect puzzle pieces by executing commands sequentially.
Or, if necessary, repeat and program to fix the problem.

<Purpose of the game>
1. You have to quickly match the puzzle by finding the puzzle piece that fits in the blank space of the puzzle.

<Game ready>
1. Spread the board plate and do not let the parts pieces face down.

<Game play>
1. You have to find the puzzle pieces that match your own color. To get the pieces of the puzzle like this, you need to use a special icon drawn on the dice.
2. Use the (Go straight), (Rotate left), (Rotate right), and (Repeat) icons to move your robot to find the piece.

<Game ends>
1. The game ends when one of the players completes the puzzle.

boardgame.name: Yowon12: Unplugged
요원12
boardgame.description:
Clever mentor'Jolly' With the help of Mir, Jolie deploys agents and checks computer functions to stabilize the computer city.
Let's explore computer terms and functions with Jolie.


What terms do you need to know to get acquainted with computers?


When using computers we come across a lot of terms.
There are also many interesting stories from the origins of computer terms.
Let's get acquainted with the computer terminology while playing a fun unplugged game with 12 agents.


cookie-It is derived from the fairy tale of Hansel and Gretel, and helps to keep the information of the sites you visited and came out of, as if you had sprinkled a piece of cookie and followed it to the house.



bug-An error occurred in the computer, and when we analyzed the cause, it was caused by a moth that entered the computer.


<Purpose of the game>
1. You have to store a lot of your cards in the storage.

<Game ready>
1. Prepare 2 board plates (memory plates).
2. On the back of each card draw 12 cards of the same color.
3. Shuffle the cards you have, place them on the front deck, and draw 3 to check.

<Game play>
1. The first player chooses 1 out of 3 cards and boards it on 1 slot (memory).
2. The next player is also placed on the board (memory) he wishes to place on his turn.
3. While placing an agent card, try executing the abilities written on the card.
4. If the board (memory) is full like this, the cards in the blue box are backed up, and the cards in the yellow box are discarded.

<Game ends>
1. The game is over when all 12 agents have completed their role. Those with a lot of backed up data win.
(If the number of data is the same, the person who dumps less in the trash wins.)

boardgame.name: Dear Stranded: A Science Fiction Letter-Writing LARP
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

Styles of Play: Letter Writing

Two stranded souls, alone and separated by a vast sea, send each other letters of comfort and confession with the help of a mysterious Helper. A science fiction letter-writing game.

Tags: Science Fiction, Letters, Confessions

boardgame.name: The Decline of Panopticritia
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

Styles of Play: Freeform larp, Chat/Message, Streaming/Online Face to Face, Video/Transmedia

An elderly dragon fades slowly, surrounded by her dwindling entourage of princesses, knights, and sentient magic items

Tags: dementia, memory, sad, magic

boardgame.name: Do I Even Exist Anymore?
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

Styles of Play: Freeform larp, Larp, Chat/Message

A human and an AI bot, both isolated and losing their sense of identity, reach out to one another. A 30 minute LARP played completely via text.

Tags: one-shot, text-based, identity, isolation

boardgame.name: Mortem et Gloriam: Battles of the Great Commanders 1 – Age of Attila
boardgame.description:
Mortem et Gloriam: Battles of the Great Commanders 1 – Age of Attila covers campaigns around the Fall of the Roman Empire. This companion book covers the context, notable leaders, armies, history, campaigns and major battles of a specific period of ancient history, combining the latest research into a guide to the period. The books contain much detail that is useful to any Ancients gamer and, in addition, ready-made refights and campaign ideas for use with Mortem et Gloriam ruleset.

This book is a supplement for the Mortem et Gloriam Compendium Edition; it is not a standalone set of rules.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Mortem et Gloriam: Wargames Rules 2000BC to 1500AD

boardgame.name: Drawing Out the Demon
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

Styles of Play: Freeform larp, Letter Writing, Chat/Message, Streaming/Online Face to Face, Arts & Crafts

A play-by-post game for 2-5 people played over several months about the creative process and constructive criticism. You are artists of small renown living in 12th century France. All of you have been commissioned to complete a piece of art that heavily features a specific animal. Unfortunately, while you may have great artistic skill in other areas, you are terrible at drawing anything relating to this one specific animal. Later, you will play modern-day art historians at an academic symposium discussing the finer details of the works created through play.

Tags: play-by-post; art; creating; correspondence

boardgame.name: Dream Phone of Cthulhu
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

Styles of Play: Freeform larp, Larp, Chat/Message

In Dream Phone of Cthulhu, it’s the ‘20s, and there have been signs and portents that your group has drawn the attention, and admiration, of a deity from the Cthulhu Mythos. You are performing a seance to contact the alluring and terrifying gods beyond the veil, to find out which one is your Secret Admirer.

Tags: phone, seance, lovecraftian, period piece

boardgame.name: Duels in the Tower of Eternity: An Epistolary Game of Sacrifice and Revolution
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

Styles of Play: Freeform larp, Larp, Letter Writing, Streaming/Online Face to Face

Two elite boarding schools, two groups of rivals dueling for the opportunity to change the world, and two friends caught in the middle. What are you willing to sacrifice to win the Prize?

Tags: epistolary, duels, revolution
boardgame.rpg: Duels in the Tower of Eternity: An Epistolary Game of Sacrifice and Revolution
